description.p: A ranger touched by the Feywild, blending eerie mirth with dreadful fury.
When you choose this subclass at 3rd level, you gain the following features.

You can augment your weapon strikes with mind-scarring magic from the Feywild. When you hit a creature with a weapon, you can deal an extra 1d4 Psychic damage to the target, which can take this extra damage only once per turn. The extra damage increases to 1d6 when you reach Ranger level 11.

sheet.description: Once per turn when you hit with a weapon, deal 1d{{dreadful strike:dice}} Psychic extra damage.

description.p: When you reach a Ranger level specified in the Fey Wanderer Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.
You also possess a fey blessing; choose it from the Feywild Gifts table in the Playerâ€™s Handbook.
Whenever you make a Charisma check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
You also gain proficiency in one of these skills of your choice: Deception, Performance, or Persuasion.
The magic of the Feywild guards your mind. You have Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Charmed or Frightened condition.

In addition, whenever you or a creature you can see within 120 feet of you succeeds on a saving throw to avoid or end the Charmed or Frightened condition, you can take a Reaction to force a different creature you can see within 120 feet of yourself to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target is Charmed or Frightened (your choice) for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

sheet.description: Advantage on saves vs Charmed/Frightened. When a creature you see succeeds on a save vs Charmed/Frightened, force another creature (within 120 ft) to make a WIS save (DC {{ranger:spellcasting:dc}}) or be Charmed or Frightened (your choice) for 1 minute (save ends at end of its turns).

description.p: You can cast Summon Fey without a Material component. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a Long Rest.
Whenever you start casting the spell, you can modify it so that it does not require Concentration. If you do so, the spellâ€™s duration becomes 1 minute for that casting.

sheet.description: You can cast Summon Fey without expending a spell slot. You can modify it so that it does not require Concentration, but the duration is reduced to 1 minute. In any case, you cast it without Material components.

description.p: You can cast Misty Step without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Whenever you cast Misty Step, you can bring along one willing creature you can see within 5 feet of yourself. That creature teleports to an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of your destination space.

sheet.description: You can cast Misty Step without expending a spell slot; you can bring with you one willing creature within 5 ft and move it to a free space within 5 ft of your destination.
